turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: I'm sorry for leaving, but I mean, Jesus, Claire...

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: I mess around with this stuff, but I never thought anything would happen.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Mrs. Feur.  She's alive.  I met her. She's really sweet.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Nothing.  It wasn't anything.  I've been on edge lately.  Maybe since the accident. And I'd prefer, I really would, to just--

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Something was there.  You saw it.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Yes.  Now I talked to Sela and there's a guy, this Pakistani guy down in Hartford...

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: And he's the real thing.  Specializes in cases like this, like yours.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: No.  Jody, listen to me.  You have to listen to me.  This is not something that I can do right now.  Whatever it was, it's gone.  I need it to be gone now.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I've got to find a bathroom.  I'll call you.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Artsy little village down seven.  There's a guy there who sells my work.  I had just dropped off some paintings and as I got in my car...I saw Norman sitting at this little cafe.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: I started to walk over...but he wasn't alone.  A blond.  I only caught a glimpse. She was young.  I should have said something right away. But I didn't.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Partly because I didn't want to hurt you...but partly...partly because I was relieved.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: I had just been left by Richard.  I was bitter and miserable and for some fucked up reason, it made me feel better that your life wasn't as perfect as it seemed.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: By the time I finally got up the nerve to tell you, Stan called from the hospital and it was too late.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Too late?  Jody, it was an accident.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Alone?  On a two lane road?  With a ton of Valium in your system?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: I got there first.  Stan covered up the pills and I had it out with Norman.  He seemed desperate not to lose you.  He promised to handle it.  And we all let it drop away.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: How could I expect you to tell me something that I wouldn't even tell myself?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: She could have hurt me if she wanted to.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: You don't know that.  If it's your belief that gives her form, then you've got to shut her out.  Somehow you have to break the connection.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: No.  She wanted me to know the truth.  Now that I do...I think she's at peace.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Jody, she tried to kill him.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I can't believe this is happening.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: We need help.  Please let me call the medium.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: That could take days.  I need to do something now.  Don't you see?  She wants us dead.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Alight, alright.  Stay calm.  You opened this door.  There's got to be a way that you can close it.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: I have an idea.  But, I mean, I'm just making this up...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: But he acted like he'd never heard of it.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: What if he was?  Do you think he wanted to bring that up again just when you're trying to make a new start?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: He's trying to put it behind him, Claire. You should too.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: You've got a beautiful life.  And even with this, it's always been clear that he loves you.  I've come to think that's all that really matters.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Trust me, Claire.  You hear something... change the subject.  You find something... get rid of it, throw it in the lake.  You know what happened.  The rest is only details.  And no one's ever glad they got a hold of those.  If you want to put this back together...just let it go.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Christ, that's twice in...When did they move in?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Feur, I think.  Psych department.  Figures. They're all psychotic.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: We'll be quiet.  Quick and quiet.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Alright.  I can't take the rejection.  I'm going to class.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Claire, I have to show up for the--

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Genetic repair mechanisms in eukaryotic organisms.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Excellent.  Couple of Swedish sailor cells just gang divided a virginal cheerleader cell.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: No, no.  I'm just about...  There.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It's just she's been the focus for a while.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: To tell you the truth...I'm excited.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: To get my life back.  To have some time for myself.  Some time for us.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You did a great job.  She's a good kid.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: And we moved out here for the quiet.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I'm finished at three.  No.  Squash with Stan.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Honey, they're young.  They're probably newlyweds.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'm telling you.  There was something in her voice...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Not like this.  We were never like this.  I want to go over there.  After dinner, we can--

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: To make sure she's all right.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Claire, honey, we are not going to march next door and accuse our new neighbor of--

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: ...when tonight they'll probably be keeping us awake.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'd never be able to live with mysel--

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Nothing's going to happen.  Besides, I have to work tonight.  The conference is in less than two weeks. I've got to stay focused on that for just a little longer.  This is...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It's what I've been working for.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I just wish you could have heard her.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Look, I'll call Harvey Tomes in the Psych department, see what I can find out.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Norman, you have to look at this!

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Nothing.  There was...I thought I saw something.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I'm stuck here for another couple of hours.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Unless you need me to come home...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: There were some noises.  I didn't want to disturb you.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What do you mean?  Some noises where?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: In the house.  I was scared.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: No.  Can you drive me home?  I'll bring you back in the morning.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: It was there.  This angry music all by itself.  And I heard whispering.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I've got the conference next week.  I want you to feel safe.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I do, I do.  I'm sure I'm just...how was your day?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Think I may have cracked it.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Madame Curie, Jonas Salk, Norman Spencer...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You know what that does to me.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Ohmigod.  You'll never believe...I saw Schumway...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: He's here giving some arcane spiel for the physics department, so Bob Shine introduces us...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: And he says...you'll fucking love this, he says, "Doctor Spencer, I am a great admirer of your work..."

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: "...of Perpetual Distances."  Everybody's checking their shoelaces. Pins drop.  "I'm afraid you've mistaken me,"  I say...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Didn't know he was dead, every stinking paper on the globe.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: That's just mean.  Oh.  Jody wanted to know if I could get her some.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Norman, you are so funny about that.  No, I didn't.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Did you call about the Feurs?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Oh, right.  Yes.  Harvey says the guy's a sweetheart.  Wouldn't hurt a fly.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: He did.  She's in the picture.  I went over to look and she's gone.  The table was set for one.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: And that means he murdered his wife? This is getting ridic--

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: No, no, no, no.  The soil on the shovel, his shovel...that's clay.  It's not from here, believe me, I...  All right, look at this.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: From the sun.  It's a reflection on the glass.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: It's her!  I'm telling you.  She whispered and turned on the music.  She's trying to contact me!

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: She could be out.  She could be sick in bed for all we know.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Okay.  Okay.  I'll bet there's...Look at this.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Right.  And why is she here?  If he killed her, why doesn't she haunt him?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: She was lonely, I talked to her.  Norman, I know how it looks, but--

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Claire, listen to me.  I know you're under some strain.  But there's no such thing as ghosts.  They don't exist.  Our neighbor did not kill his wife, and I...wait, why aren't you dressed?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Dinner.  With Stan and his new girl.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What do you mean?  Claire, we talked about it.  You didn't want Japanese, I said, Our first date since...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Yes, tonight.  We're going to be--

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: When you do this, I swear...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Okay, okay, I'm sure that I just...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Restaurant.  Let them know we're running late.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I know I'm not at the center of the bridge.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What can it hurt to talk to someone?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Claire, she's been a huge part of your life for seventeen years.  If you weren't thrown off balance by this, then something would be wrong.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I never said I wasn't upset.  Of course I'm upset.  I miss her terribly.  But I know what I saw and what I heard...and it wasn't some "symptom" of something...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: ...and I don't think I'm some lonely, middle-aged woman cracking up.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: No!  And I don't need a psychiatrist!

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What are you doing out here?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: He killed her.  I'm not crazy.  He killed her and--

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Yes.  And he's going to get away with it.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Jody and I.  And she was there, Norman, she was.  It scared Jody so bad she had to leave.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Jody brought a Ouija board and we summoned her.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Maybe you resent how busy I've been.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You know what I've got at stake with this paper.  You know that.  I can't help but think that you're doing this now to hurt me, or to sabotage me somehow.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Ever since the accident I've been worried that you'd been unhappy, or...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: But then you've been so much better...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Norman, this isn't about you.  This is something that's happening to me.  It's not to get even...and it's not some warped bid for attention.  Some strange things are happening in our house, whether you believe in them or not...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: No!  Not sweetheart, no.  I believe in what's happening.  I don't want to, but I do.  I guess I was foolish enough to think that would be enough for you.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Maybe you're right.  Maybe I'm losing my mind...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: ...I'm pulling up, Yuri.  I'll see you for dinner.  Sure you won't stay?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Good.  You sat in front...I saw you there...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You were lost in the music...eyes closed...your chest heaving...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You told me that I was...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: When she said it, there was something familiar...but no.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: A cheap wine glass from the caterers.  You started crying.  I tried to comfort you...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You shoved me away and ran out to the patio.  I took you home.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: But why?  I can't understand how I could just completely--

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It was maybe a week after the accident. We were moving.  It was a hard time.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Sweetheart, it was over a year ago.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I may have seen her on campus.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: No.  I'm afraid to ask what this is about.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: It's her.  This is the woman who I've seen.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I thought it was Mrs. Feur, but it's not...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I take it your not mad at me.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Why don't you shut up and fuck me, Professor.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I think she's starting to suspect something.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I came to work in the garden and I saw you with her...in my house.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I snuck back to my car, trying to convince myself it never happened.  And when I woke up in the hospital...somehow it hadn't.  Until now.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It was last year.  We were having troubles.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: DON'T touch me.  Just get away from me. Go!

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: What did you think I would do?  Jesus Christ!  I gave up my life and my music...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I never asked you to quit!

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: ...Oh BULLSHIT.  You had to topple perfect Daddy and that meant perfect wife, perfect family...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: THAT'S NOT TRUE!  You wanted to quit!  And then when you did, you hated me for it... so you gave it all to her.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: And then out of nowhere, some bright young woman found me attractive...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: ...would do anything just to be around me.  And I slipped.  God help me, I slipped.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'm not going to listen to this.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I tried to break it off!

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: She was damaged and unstable.  The more I tried to distance myself, the more desperate she became.  Finally, she showed up at the new house...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: How did she know where it was?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: We don't know that for sure.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Of course she did, Norman.  What else could it be?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: We have to get out of here.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Can't you see, she's trying to kill us.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: She can't be here without me.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I don't know, but I am.  She was there and then she was gone.  I felt it.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Incredible.  We should take a drive before they're gone.  Spend the night at some cozy little bed and breakfast.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Yep.  There's some great places nearby.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Little village down seven.  Supposed to be charming.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Maybe we can stop there for lunch.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You don't have to do that.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: She's out there isn't she?  She's in the lake.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Okay.  Don't...you don't understand what this is.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Don't I, Norman?  YOU KEPT THE FUCKING NECKLACE.  Of a woman you killed!

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I did NOT!  I did not kill anyone.  Jesus. Claire, listen to me.  I walked in and she was lying there dead.  I swear to you.  On my life!  She took pills and she killed herself in our house to destroy me!  To destroy us!  If I hadn't stopped by here before school, the painters would have--

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: IT'S TRUE.  That's...you have to believe me!  Oh God, I'm telling you the truth!  I did what I had to, Claire.  She was gone.  There was nothing I could do for her.  I did...I put her in the lake.  I rolled the car in...and I watched it sink.  And I've lived with that image ever since.  I couldn't just stand there while everything-- my career, us, everything, just washed away.  Don't you see, Claire?  She's doing this!  This is exactly what she wants you to think!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: :No, I said, I hate what I'm doing to Darcy. Oh, boy, men are stupider, it's true.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: :What do you mean "They" are? Are you officially a woman now?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: :Oh, I wish. A woman wouldn't have screwed over the woman she loved. No, they don't think that way.

turns.speaker: AARON
turns.text: Many times over the past thirty years. Why he shows himself to me, I don't know but Lasher's not some mindless wraith.

turns.speaker: AARON
turns.text: A spacial entity.  An organized energy.  something that precedes our definition of existence.

turns.speaker: AARON
turns.text: Going away doesn't mean you leave Lasher behind. He was on Rowan's deck - and the plane...  geography seems irrelevant now.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Michael - you loved that house as a child.  You could work again! You could make it ours. We'll sweep out the horror.  And Lasher with it!

turns.speaker: AARON
turns.text: Thank you for this honor, my dear.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: You've been shadowing the family for thirty years.  It's only fitting you give one af us away.

turns.speaker: AARON
turns.text: I've grown very fond of you you and Michael both.
